content:
• Wednesday, January 16, 2013
  • LAMR

    Outdoor advertiser Lamar Advertising (NASDAQ:LAMR) moves up on the back of the CBS (NYSE:CBS)...

    Outdoor advertiser Lamar Advertising (NASDAQ:LAMR) moves up on the back of the CBS (NYSE:CBS) report that it's converting its outdoor adverting unit - including its billboards and transit & street advertising - into a REIT. LAMR has been studying a conversion to a REIT since August of last year. Shares +2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM
  • KSWS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: KSWS +57%. CBS +8%. ARQL +5%. FOLD +4%. PLXS +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: KSWS +57%. CBS +8%. ARQL +5%. FOLD +4%. PLXS +4%.
    After-hours top losers: COLM -9%. NTI -4%. HGG -4%. SLM -3%. FET -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • COLM

    Columbia Sportswear (NASDAQ:COLM) cuts Q4 expectations as the maker of active outdoor apparel's...

    Columbia Sportswear (NASDAQ:COLM) cuts Q4 expectations as the maker of active outdoor apparel's net sales were hurt by mild winter weather during most of the holiday shopping season, leading to lower customer traffic in key markets and a more promotional environment. For the quarter, the company now expects revenue to be in the range of $37M to $40M, with a net sales decline of 5% to $499Mto $503M. Estimates back in October were for around $44M in revenue and net sales growth of as much as 1.5%. Shares -9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • NTI

    Northern Tier Energy (NYSE:NTI) -3.1% AH after announcing a public offering of 9M common units...

    Northern Tier Energy (NYSE:NTI) -3.1% AH after announcing a public offering of 9M common units representing limited partner interests held by Northern Tier Holdings. NTI will receive no proceeds from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • AVEO

    AVEO Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVEO) announces a secondary offering for an undisclosed amount of...

    AVEO Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVEO) announces a secondary offering for an undisclosed amount of shares. All of the shares in the offering are to be sold by AVEO, with JPMorgan acting as sole book-running manager and RBC Capital Markets and Canaccord as co-lead managers. Shares -1.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • HPTX

    Shares of Hyperion Therapeutics (HPTX +19%) shook off early weakness to close markedly higher...

    Shares of Hyperion Therapeutics (HPTX +19%) shook off early weakness to close markedly higher today after the FDA advised the company earlier not to expect a final action on its PDUFA date of January 23 for Ravicti, its treatment for Urea Cycle Disorders. The agency told the company that it's continuing to work on label and post-marketing requirements in connection with the New Drug Application.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • PLXS

    Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS): FQ1 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $531M (flat% Y/Y) misses by...

    Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS): FQ1 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $531M (flat% Y/Y) misses by $20.98M. Shares +3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • CBS

    CBS +7% AH after announcing it plans to convert its Americas outdoor advertising unit into a...

    CBS +7% AH after announcing it plans to convert its Americas outdoor advertising unit into a REIT, and to divest its European and Asian outdoor ad ops. CBS will request an IRS ruling on the status of the Americas business during Q1; if granted, the REIT conversion could be completed in the taxable year starting 2014. CBS' Outdoor segment posted Q3 revenue of $486M (+2% Y/Y).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • HLF

    Carl Icahn - the latest player in the Herbalife (HLF -2%) drama - renews his call for Bill...

    Carl Icahn - the latest player in the Herbalife (HLF -2%) drama - renews his call for Bill Ackman's head after reports begin making rounds (again) that the mega-investor has in fact confirmed with his clients he'd taken a long position in the stock. Reports circulated last week that Icahn had already built a small stake in the company, which wouldn't surprise many considering the bad blood running between the two hedge fund giants.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ +4.4%) jumps on a WSJ report the company has "received expressions of interest,"...

    H-P (HPQ +4.4%) jumps on a WSJ report the company has "received expressions of interest," primarily from "other U.S. tech companies or their representatives," for its struggling Autonomy and EDS units. However, Meg Whitman is said to be uninterested for now, and one source adds it's unclear if EDS, hit hard by H-P's layoffs, can be extracted from the company. Odds are any offer for Autonomy will be well below the $11B H-P paid for it last year, in light of recent events. CRN claimed in September H-P has held talks about selling EDS, but the company denied it.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 4 Comments
  • IRWD

    Shares of Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -7.5%) slide after posting a Q4 earnings beat...

    Shares of Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -7.5%) slide after posting a Q4 earnings beat yesterday, but posting a 16% Y/Y decline in total revenue. UBS cut the shares to Sell this morning after the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • DNN

    Among the Fission Energy assets being acquired by Denison (DNN +3.4%) is a 60% stake in the...

    Among the Fission Energy assets being acquired by Denison (DNN +3.4%) is a 60% stake in the Waterbury Lake uranium project, part of a deposit attached to Rio Tinto’s (RIO -1.9%) Roughrider deposit - which Cantor Fitzgerald says "ties a neat bow on top of Denison for a potential takeout offer" from RIO. The analyst also considers Cameco (CCJ -1.2%) a potential source of a competing offer for Fission.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • PERI

    Perion Networks (PERI +1.5%) gains after Benchmark starts the shares with a Buy rating and a...

    Perion Networks (PERI +1.5%) gains after Benchmark starts the shares with a Buy rating and a $17.00 price target. Benchmark says accelerating search revenue and increasing product sales leave the company poised to achieve organic growth of 20 - 25%, and core margins will continue to improve due to scale and increasing internal efficiencies. EBITDA margins should approach 24% in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • LLTC

    Chip stocks are outperforming (SOXX +1.1%) in spite of receiving soft top-line numbers from...

    Chip stocks are outperforming (SOXX +1.1%) in spite of receiving soft top-line numbers from Linear Tech (LLTC +1.4%): the chipmaker missed FQ2 revenue estimates and guided for FQ3 Q/Q revenue growth of 1%-4%, below a 5% consensus. S&P 500 chip companies are already expected to post a 28.7% Y/Y earnings drop for calendar Q4 (per Thomson Reuters), thus expectations are quite low. Intel (INTC +0.9%) reports tomorrow: the consensus revenue forecast of $13.51B is below the midpoint of the chip giant's $13.1B-$14.1B guidance range.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • ESLT

    Elbit Systems (ESLT +1.6%) says one of its subsidiaries has been awarded a contract by the U.S....

    Elbit Systems (ESLT +1.6%) says one of its subsidiaries has been awarded a contract by the U.S. Army to supply its Skylark I-LE Block II as an alternative Medium and Long-Range Small Unmanned Aircraft System. Additionally, the award includes providing support and capability upgrades to current systems including the RQ-11B Raven and the RQ-20A Puma.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC -4.8%) is lower amidst reports the USPTO has rejected all of the claims in the...

    VirnetX (VHC -4.8%) is lower amidst reports the USPTO has rejected all of the claims in the company's '949 patent, which is being asserted in a suit against Apple, in a re-examination. If true, expect VirnetX to appeal; the company is also asserting other patents against Apple. Update: SA author Chris Hofmann points out the USPTO issued an action closing prosecution (.pdf) for claims in VirnetX's '181 patent, which is asserted in an ITC case against Apple. VirnetX has 30 days to respond to the rejections made.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 24 Comments
  • OLED

    Heavily-shorted Universal Display (PANL +4.6%) is rallying again today - shares are up 10% from...

    Heavily-shorted Universal Display (PANL +4.6%) is rallying again today - shares are up 10% from Monday's close. A recently-spotted Samsung slide noted a 4.99" 1080p OLED display will arrive in Q1 - there's a good chance it will go into the Galaxy S IV - but a display launch along these lines was expected. CES brought with it an array of OLED TV announcements and flexible OLED demos.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • VEON

    VimpelCom (VIP +4.4%) treks higher after outlining its 2013-2015 objectives ahead of its Analyst...

    VimpelCom (VIP +4.4%) treks higher after outlining its 2013-2015 objectives ahead of its Analyst & Investor Day. The Russian mobile carrier says it's shooting mid-single-digit revenue and EBITDA CAGRs, and wants to have a net debt/EBITDA ratio below 2x by the end of 2015. It also wants its capex/revenue ratio (exc. spectrum license payments) to be under 15% by the end of this period, and for $2B/year in operating cash flow improvement to be achieved. (webcast and slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • RGR

    Sturm, Ruger (RGR +3.7%), Cabelas (CAB +5.6%), and Smith & Wesson (SWHC +2.6%) trade higher...

    Sturm, Ruger (RGR +3.7%), Cabelas (CAB +5.6%), and Smith & Wesson (SWHC +2.6%) trade higher after President Obama signs 23 executive orders on gun control limits which come in addition to the laws the administration is pushing Congress to pass. While there is little question the companies will post stellar earnings in Q1, the debate focuses now on how long the demand rush will last or what will be the whipsaw action if the NRA helps blocks some of the pending legislation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 6 Comments
  • CLRO

    Midday top 10 gainers: CLRO +49%. NVTL +17%. HPTX +16%. FSGI +16%. CBK +14%. PLBC +13%. BOSC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CLRO +49%. NVTL +17%. HPTX +16%. FSGI +16%. CBK +14%. PLBC +13%. BOSC +13%. FSI +12%. CYTR +10%. ADES +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: GALT -9%. LODE -8%. AMRS -8%. PGNX -8%. IRWD -7%. CROX -7%. GDOT -7%. AXX -7%. YOD -7%. AIM -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • BK

    Moving lower in a mostly green financial sector is BNY Mellon (BK -2.8%) after its earnings...

    Moving lower in a mostly green financial sector is BNY Mellon (BK -2.8%) after its earnings report. Net interest margin wasn't pretty - declining to 1.09% from 1.20% in Q3 and 1.27% a year ago. No longer able to gouge customers on fx transactions, a custodial bank like BNY can't do a whole lot to offset declining margins. The good news: AUM posted a 10% rise. Someday ZIRP will end. State Street (NYSE:STT) -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +3.2%) is rallying again today. CrackBerry has posted a leaked BB10...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +3.2%) is rallying again today. CrackBerry has posted a leaked BB10 training manual that provides plenty of new images of RIM's next-gen OS and its related apps. The images show off BB10's social networking capabilities, multitasking tools, and Web browser, as well as some hyped features such as BlackBerry Flow and BlackBerry Remember. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH +1.1%) gains after Raymond James initiated the stock with a Strong Buy...

    Accretive Health (AH +1.1%) gains after Raymond James initiated the stock with a Strong Buy earlier today and a $16.00 price target. The firm notes four bullish components to AH's story: a shift from an information technology focus to to revenue cycle; a differentiated infused management model; margin expansion potential; and expectations for multiple expansion with its Minnesota litigation in the rearview mirror.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • VALE

    The recent selloff in Vale (VALE -2.2%) may provide a buying opportunity, Goldman Sachs says,...

    The recent selloff in Vale (VALE -2.2%) may provide a buying opportunity, Goldman Sachs says, pointing to rallying iron ore prices and the firm's expectations that global demand will keep prices high. Goldman also thinks investors have underestimated Vale’s ability to reduce expenses, which could let the miner increase its 2013 dividend.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    P-E firm TPG Capital has walked away from Dell (DELL-OLD -4.2%) LBO talks, multiple sources tell...

    P-E firm TPG Capital has walked away from Dell (DELL-OLD -4.2%) LBO talks, multiple sources tell Fortune. That leaves Silver Lake as the sole suitor for the company. Like the WSJ's report, Fortune's column notes Michael Dell, said to be "keenly interested in continuing to lead" post-LBO, could be an impediment to a deal, given he's unlikely to support huge management changes or a major strategy shift.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATRC

    AtriCure (ATRC +3.4%) removes an overhang to trade higher today, after pricing its previously...

    AtriCure (ATRC +3.4%) removes an overhang to trade higher today, after pricing its previously announced 3.475M share secondary offering at $7.25 per share, just a 3.2% discount to yesterday's close. The company currently has a 16.7M share float.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • SNCR

    Synchronoss (SNCR +3.5%) catches a bid following an upgrade to Outperform from Credit Suisse:...

    Synchronoss (SNCR +3.5%) catches a bid following an upgrade to Outperform from Credit Suisse: the firm is encouraged by top customer AT&T's smartphone sales and an R&D tax credit extension, and sees a potential Q2 iPhone launch giving a lift. Wells Fargo upgraded Synchronoss last week on a belief ramping sales to Verizon Wireless and a new cloud services contract with AT&T will provide a 2013 lift.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • AAPL

    Is the bad news fully baked in? Apple (AAPL +3.6%), which closed yesterday trading around 7.4x...

    Is the bad news fully baked in? Apple (AAPL +3.6%), which closed yesterday trading around 7.4x FY13E EPS (exc. cash), has rallied back above $500 in spite of Pac Crest's downgrade. The company has received favorable notes today as well: Cowen says its checks lead it to believe Apple's smartphone share rose to ~23.5% in calendar Q4 from 16.4% in Q3. Some suppliers are also up: CRUS +4.5%. OVTI +1.4%. Sterne Agee is defending Skyworks (SWKS +3.5%) after meeting with its CFO.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 42 Comments
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN +4.7%) opened lower in response to its Q4 report, but has shot higher after guiding...

    Adtran (ADTN +4.7%) opened lower in response to its Q4 report, but has shot higher after guiding on its call for Q1 revenue to be similar to Q4 levels, and for the company to grow in 2013 as regulatory issues (presumably related to U.S. broadband spending). Analysts currently expect Q1 revenue to be down fractionally Q/Q, and for 2013 revenue to be roughly flat with 2012 levels. CIEN +3.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX -3.2%) thrash around with competing rumors out on what David Einhorn and...

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX -3.2%) thrash around with competing rumors out on what David Einhorn and Carl Icahn might have up their sleeve with their respective positions or non-positions. Though the company continues to line up attractive (and expensive) content deals right and left, trading sentiment is focused on what the big names might or might not do.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -3.3%) adds to the losses it saw yesterday following's Facebook's Graph Search launch...

    Yelp (YELP -3.3%) adds to the losses it saw yesterday following's Facebook's Graph Search launch thanks to a downgrade to Underperform from Northland's Darren Aftahi. Aftahi declares Graph Search, which has been lauded by some reviewers, to be "highly competitive to Yelp, as the platform provides a unique alternative to local business search." Of course, people have made similar remarks about Foursquare, Google/Zagat, and a few other would-be rivals.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 4 Comments
  • SHPG

    ViroPharma (VPHM -2%) releases data on Cinryze when used in pediatric patients with symptoms of...

    ViroPharma (VPHM -2%) releases data on Cinryze when used in pediatric patients with symptoms of hereditary angioedema attacks which showed it reduced the rate of attacks. The drug is already approved by the FDA for routine treatment against angioedema attacks in adolescent and adult patients, but not yet approved for use in children. Sidenote: BAML just yesterday upped the shares to Buy due to higher Cinrynze sales projections.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • CRM

    Having closed near its all-time high yesterday, Salesforce.com (CRM -2.6%) has spiked lower...

    Having closed near its all-time high yesterday, Salesforce.com (CRM -2.6%) has spiked lower after filing a response to an SEC staff letter that was sent to CFO Graham Smith on Aug. 24. The letter asks for details about Salesforce's operating cash flow figures - in particular, the impact of working capital changes, the managing of accounts receivable, and factors that affect deferred revenue changes. It also asks Salesforce to break out U.S. sales, rather than just disclose Americas revenue. Some SA authors have taken aim at Salesforce's accounting in the past.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 7 Comments
  • GM

    Shares of General Motors (GM -3.7%) dip after the automaker's performance in Europe appears to...

    Shares of General Motors (GM -3.7%) dip after the automaker's performance in Europe appears to be even more sluggish than anticipated. The bleeding could get even worse, according to analysts. A phenomenon known as "peak-car" is affecting demand as the car market reaches closer to a saturation point with less drivers amid widespread economic troubles. As a result, a bounce back to previous levels of sales is not widely anticipated.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • BWLD

    Shares of Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD -2%) and Panera (PNRA -1.7%) trail off after Chipotle reports...

    Shares of Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD -2%) and Panera (PNRA -1.7%) trail off after Chipotle reports troubling food costs and lukewarm comparable-store sales growth for Q4. With the bloom off of Chipotle a bit, sector valuations could be adjusted downwards.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • BA

    ANA plans to maintain Boeing's (NYSE:BA) 787 as a crucial part of its strategy despite the...

    ANA plans to maintain Boeing's (NYSE:BA) 787 as a crucial part of its strategy despite the Dreamliner's latest problems and emergency landing, with the carrier still intending to receive a total of 66 787s by 2021. Meanwhile, Goldman removes Boeing from its "Conviction" list and cuts its price target to $90 from $98, but keeps its "Buy" rating. For a timeline of the problems, click here. Boeing is -4.2% at $73.70.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) +2.3% after Bloomberg reports 23%-owned Alibaba has hired Credit Suisse and Goldman...

    Yahoo (YHOO) +2.3% after Bloomberg reports 23%-owned Alibaba has hired Credit Suisse and Goldman to arrange a $3B-$4B Hong Kong IPO. But the same article quotes an Alibaba spokesman as saying his company hasn't "hired any banks in connection with any IPOs." Alibaba was valued at $35B in last year's buyback deal and is continuing to grow like a weed. The report comes a day after Jack Ma announced his planned resignation as CEO (but not chairman). (AllThingsD report)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) shoots 6.6% higher premarket after issuing strong guidance for FQ4....

    Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) shoots 6.6% higher premarket after issuing strong guidance for FQ4. The retailer's report caught traders off-guard after they got skittish with the sudden resignation of the firm's CFO last week. Tomorrow the company presents at the ICR XChange Conference where hints on Q1 traffic could be dropped.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD) -3.6% to $12.69 after the WSJ reports LBO talks involve a price range of...

    Dell (DELL-OLD) -3.6% to $12.69 after the WSJ reports LBO talks involve a price range of $13-$14/share. Backing up prior reports (I, II), the paper says Silver Lake is involved in the talks, and that the equity portion of the deal amounts to $2B. That would still leave Dell's would-be buyers needing to raise ~$15B in debt, after Michael Dell's $3.6B+ stake is thrown in. Advisers are reportedly "trying to bring the negotiations to a close quickly."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are mixed as the S&P benchmark falls 0.1% and the Dow 0.4%,...

    Market preview: Stock futures are mixed as the S&P benchmark falls 0.1% and the Dow 0.4%, but the Nasdaq rises 0.15%, possibly helped up by Apple (+1.4%) after a rough couple of days for the tech giant. Boeing is -3.8% following yet another incident with its 787 jet, although it's pared some of its earlier losses. Following earnings, Goldman Sachs is +2.5% and JPMorgan is +0.1%, but Chipotle is -8.5%. Later: NAHB Housing Market Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CROX

    Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) files an 8-K with the SEC in advance of its presentation at the high-profile...

    Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) files an 8-K with the SEC in advance of its presentation at the high-profile ICR XChange conference. In the document, the retailer says revenue will be in line with prior guidance and backlog for H1 2013 will be up 15% Y/Y. CROX -3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • GNW

    Premarket gainers: GNW +10%. TTMI +7%. VRA +7%.Losers: CMG -8%. CIE -7%. CRS -6%.

    Premarket gainers: GNW +10%. TTMI +7%. VRA +7%.
    Losers: CMG -8%. CIE -7%. CRS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • BA

    Polish carrier LOT says it has been told by Boeing (NYSE:BA) that the plane-maker had known...

    Polish carrier LOT says it has been told by Boeing (NYSE:BA) that the plane-maker had known about the problems affecting Japanese-owned 787 jets and had fixed them in aircraft that were assembled later. Boeing (BA) is -4.4% premarket following the latest problem today with the 787, which has prompted Japanese airlines to ground their Dreamliners. LOT, though, is continuing its 787 flights as normal.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • K

    More cereal malaise: Credit Suisse downgrades Kellogg (NYSE:K) to Underperform from Neutral. The...

    More cereal malaise: Credit Suisse downgrades Kellogg (NYSE:K) to Underperform from Neutral. The analyst cut follows a slash by Goldman Sachs on General Mills last week on the same dim view of the growth potential for cereal brands. K -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM

  • Japanese shares lead Asian and European stocks lower as the yen strengthens for a second day...

    Japanese shares lead Asian and European stocks lower as the yen strengthens for a second day following comments from the country's economy minister that the currency's declines have gone far enough. "The correction was rapid because the market went up too fast," says technical analyst Shoichiro Yamauchi. "The yen weakened too quickly, making investors adjust their positions." Japan -2.6%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China -0.7%, India -0.3%. EU Stoxx 50 -0.4%, London -0.4%, Paris -0.3%, Frankfurt -0.4%, Milan -0.9%, Madrid -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 AM
